text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today I'm 
making a dish with a really fun name it's called

choo chee and choo chee is basically a dish that involves any 
kind of seafood with a red curry sauce poured on

top it is incredibly easy but it also looks really 
good so it's a great dinner party dish today I'm

making mine with mackerel which is my favorite 
fish but you can use any other kind of fish or

any other kind of seafood shrimp squid whatever 
you want let's get started so I've got to walk

here but you can do this in any small saute pan 
or a little pot we're only making a little bit

of sauce to this I'm going to add some coconut 
milk so this process is going to look exactly

like standard curry making process so once it's 
come to a boil I'm going to add some red curry

paste now this is one that I made myself but you 
can definitely use a store-bought one the only

thing I will say is this is a very concentrated 
sauce so when I make it myself I put less salt

and less shrimp paste in it so that it doesn't 
get too salty so you have to be careful when

you use a store-bought paste definitely taste 
it before you add any fish sauce to it and let

it reduce until thick what I'm looking for here 
is not only for the curry paste to be thick but

also for the coconut oil to start separating from 
the paste so as you can see there's lots of oil

that's bubbling around the edges of the curry 
paste that's what you're looking for however I

will say that if it doesn't happen for you and 
you've cooked it for a while don't worry about

it especially if you're using canned coconut milk 
it tends to not happen with canned coconut milk

so now I'm going to go in with some sugar some 
palm sugar to balance out the saltiness and the

rest of my coconut milk break up all the lumps and 
you can kind of tell that this is homemade curry

paste because it's not as fine as a commercial 
paste but that's okay it's a little rustic some

fish sauce I want to bring this to a boil and I'm 
going to reduce this now until it's a thick sauce

consistency and meanwhile I'm going to chop up 
my kaffir lime leaves so kaffir lime leaves is

the herb for true cheese not to achieve without 
kaffir lime leaves pull off the the rib the center

riff just like that wow this is a massive one so 
grab the base of the stem and just pull it off and

it should come off pretty easily and that's just 
tough finally finally julienne it as fine as you

can because this is a pretty tough leaf and if 
you don't chop it really finely you will feel it

in your mouth and it's not very comfortable all 
right the sauce is looking good but I'm going

to reduce it a little bit more still a little too 
runny I'm going to add my kaffir lime leaves right

now but I'm not adding everything I'm saving 
some for final garnish your your line leaves

just has such a great citrusy smell smells like 
Thailand to me mmm and it really just brightens

everything up because this is quite a rich sauce 
so that sharp citrusy aroma really works well to

balance it that looks good to me I'm going to turn 
this off see how this is sort of the consistency

that you want it to be rich thick and not like 
a soupy curry like our curries usually are mmm

now you want the sauce to be strong almost too 
strong to be had on its own because that's the

idea it's going to go on fish and then it's also 
going to be had with rice so if this sort of

tastes perfect to you a little extra splash 
of soy sauce will actually make it perfect

when you mix it with rice and fish all right 
I'm going to set this aside and let's work on

the fish I'm using macro fillet today and in 
Thailand mackerel is actually really popular

with chuchi except our macro is not this kind 
it's a short mackerel it's about this big it's

called flat ooh but you can use other kinds of 
fish shrimp and squid also work really well but

I love sort of the meatiness and savoriness 
of the macro so I'm going to pan fry these

so I'm gonna heat my sauce back up because it 
has gone cold take this fish and drop it into

the sauce and that will allow some of the 
flavor from the curry to penetrate into the

fish and I'm not actually going to cover the 
fish with the sauce because I do want the skin

to show and I played it I just want the fish to 
bathe in the sauce for a little bit to marry the

flavors together and that's it that is done 
I'm going to plate that now all right gonna

spoon the sauce sort of around the fish with 
the last little bit of sauce just go ahead and

pour it across the fish's body just a little bit 
let me just wipe that off cuz it's been driving

me crazy very good now there's a very standard 
set of garnish for this dish and that is some

sort of a red pepper and now normally I'd use 
spiritual ease I didn't have any fresh one at

the time so I'm just going to do some bell pepper 
then then thin julienne so it's sort of slice off

the inside layer that's clear like that and then 
you go and make very small julienne putting this

together so a little extra coconut milk to sort 
of create some color contrast this is of course

optional if you want to make it pretty some of 
the extra julienned kaffir lime leaves that we

made earlier finely julienned bell pepper and that 
is chuchi can't wait let's taste it now normally

you would have this with rice but I forgot to make 
rice so I'm just gonna have it straight up ooh now

careful with macro love using macro there's a lot 
of bones a lot of little bones get sauce on there

mmm I love mackerel that flavor that intense needy 
texture and the strong flavor it really holds up

well to a really flavorful sauce like this one and 
if you love panang curry you can probably tell now

that this is really similar to Penang curry but 
the pace is different this doesn't have the cumin

and the coriander that or the peanuts that Penang 
does so it is quite a different animal and you saw

how easy that was so few ingredients so I do hope 
you give this a try recipe as always on Hawk I am

calm and send me a photo because it's so pretty 
on Facebook Twitter or Instagram and I will see

you next time for your next delicious Thai meal 
today I'm making a really dish Fundy I lost it
